decks.notes: This Jund Aggro deck focuses on utilizing artifact creatures and sacrificing them for value, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with removal spells and land destruction. The deck aims to maintain board presence and outvalue opponents with synergies between sacrificing artifacts, generating tokens, and disrupting the opponent's graveyard strategies. The deck also includes some graveyard hate to deal with graveyard-based strategies commonly seen in the Pauper format. Overall, the deck focuses on a proactive game plan that aims to overwhelm the opponent and control the game's pace.

This Mono Blue Aggro deck focuses on quickly playing cheap, aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Cryptic Serpent to pressure the opponent. It also includes a range of cheap cantrips like Brainstorm, Thought Scour, and Mental Note to draw cards and enable efficient plays. Counterspell provides protection against opponent's spells while Tolarian Terror and Lórien Revealed can help clear the way for attacks. Deem Inferior and Sleep of the Dead provide additional disruption, while Ponder helps with card selection. Dispel and Spell Pierce offer additional defense, and Deep Analysis provides late-game card advantage.

This deck is focused on quickly building up a board presence with low-cost creatures and cheap spells to control the game tempo. By using counterspells and disruption, the deck aims to keep the opponent on the defensive while steadily attacking with creatures like Delver of Secrets and Cryptic Serpent. The goal is to maintain pressure on the opponent while ensuring card advantage through draw and filter spells like Brainstorm and Ponder. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a consistent stream of threats and disruption, ultimately leading to victory through aggression and control.

The focus of this deck is to maintain card advantage while utilizing efficient creatures and disruptive spells to pressure the opponent. By closely monitoring card draw and utilizing cheap counterspells, the deck aims to control the game tempo and quickly establish a board presence with evasive threats. The inclusion of powerful creatures like Cryptic Serpent and Delver of Secrets, alongside card selection tools like Brainstorm and Ponder, allow the deck to maintain aggression while efficiently managing resources. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced, efficient strategy that capitalizes on tempo advantage.

The deck focuses on low-cost aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal fast damage. It also includes some artifact removal and graveyard hate to disrupt the opponent's strategies. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive gameplay with a mix of white and red mana sources. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain that pressure through efficient creatures and removal spells.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board and hand, while generating card advantage and locking down the game with powerful threats like Murmuring Mystic and Tolarian Terror. It combines efficient removal spells like Cast Down and Snuff Out with powerful counter magic like Counterspell and Spell Pierce to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistent card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through a balance of control elements and win conditions.

The main idea of this Mono Blue Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence with inexpensive creatures like Faerie Seer and Faerie Miscreant, then disrupt the opponent's game plan with Counterspell and Spellstutter Sprite. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent with evasive threats like Ninja of the Deep Hours and Harrier Strix, while also drawing cards and maintaining tempo with cards like Of One Mind and Snap. The deck also includes some removal options like Bind the Monster and Illvoi Galeblade to deal with opponent's threats.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive red creatures and burn spells. By efficiently using mana and utilizing cards like Burning-Tree Emissary to cast multiple spells in one turn, this deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. Cards like Goblin Bushwhacker and Rally at the Hornburg give the deck an additional boost in power, while Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast help control the board and deal direct damage to the opponent. Overall, this deck aims to win as fast as possible through a combination of creatures and burn spells.

The main concept of this deck is to maintain control over the board by using a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and creature destruction. The deck utilizes Golgari and Jund cards to generate value through sacrifice effects and recursion, while also being able to gain life and draw cards. The key strategy is to outvalue the opponent by constantly replenishing resources and disrupting their game plan, ultimately overwhelming them with a combination of creature threats and removal spells.

This deck focuses on building a fast-paced and efficient Elf tribal strategy, utilizing cards like Birchlore Rangers, Timberwatch Elf, and Priest of Titania to ramp up mana and overwhelm the opponent quickly. Lead the Stampede and Winding Way help to refill the hand with more Elves, while cards like Nyxborn Hydra and Avenging Hunter provide big threats to finish the game. The inclusion of cards like Masked Vandal and Arbor Elf offer versatility and disruption against opposing strategies, creating a well-rounded and powerful Aggro deck.

This deck focuses on chaining together spells to generate large amounts of mana using the High Tide combo. By casting multiple cantrips and drawing cards, the deck aims to find High Tide and mana-producing spells to create a powerful mana engine. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Gigadrowse and Lórien Revealed to protect the combo and control the opponent's board. With the ability to generate a significant amount of mana in a single turn, the deck can potentially win the game by casting a large X spell or chaining together multiple spells for a lethal combo.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and sacrificing them for various effects to deal damage quickly and efficiently. It combines aggression with synergy among artifact creatures and spells. It incorporates a mix of artifact lands, mana acceleration, card draw, and removal to maintain a strong presence on the board while disrupting the opponent's strategy. By efficiently using artifact resources and sacrificing them strategically, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of direct damage and a strong board presence.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a combination of removal spells, card draw, and recursion. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating value through sacrificing creatures and gaining life. The deck utilizes a mix of efficient removal spells like Snuff Out and Cast Down, along with creatures like Crypt Rats and Troll of Khazad-dûm to control the board. Additionally, cards like Pulse of Murasa and Lembas provide ways to recur key creatures and gain life to outlast opponents in longer games. The deck's win condition can be achieved through grinding out advantages over time.

Utilize various sacrifice effects and land destruction to gain advantage over opponents, while using artifacts and creatures to generate value and maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle, aiming to disrupt the opponent's game plan and control the board effectively. With a mix of removal, card draw, and graveyard hate, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its versatile strategy and efficient resource management.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent with low-cost creatures and burn spells. It utilizes efficient creatures like Voldaren Epicure and Burning-Tree Emissary to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. The deck also includes powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Fireblast to finish off the opponent or clear the way for attacks. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast damage output and close out the game before they have a chance to establish their own strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly play out cheap artifacts and creatures, taking advantage of affinity cost reduction. By efficiently casting spells such as Myr Enforcer and Steelfin Whale, the deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent early in the game. The inclusion of cards like Metallic Rebuke and Retraction Helix provides some control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of creatures, artifacts, and spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy while maintaining some versatility in its gameplay.
